TopicTitle: KSP 0.90 'Beta Than Ever' Grand Discussion Thread!

Articles.Content:
Attention passengers: the hype train will come to a sudden stop. We will have over 49,0000 gs of force. Please, fasten your seatbelts and HARGHNTFRSAHJ

8IABAOGLAB my head hurts but BETA THAN EVEAHHHH

Argh, I really have to sleep now... Gaming session tomorrow!

Great job SQUAD
Am I late? OH NO BLABBBLBBL MUST PLAY KSP
Awesome! hope water landings are fixed!

That might work, good idea! Anyone have such a MM cfg?

Might or might not work, I am a bit out of practice.


@PART[*]:HAS[PhysicsSignificance=1]
{
	@mass=0.00
}

Any objections from professionals?
Man... ksp servers are bekng slammed I was trying to downooad and just keep ketting mysql failures lol
HIlarious.. I just installed 0.25 and got all my mods set up, and you release .90 right when I come back to get mechjeb and finish it off.. IRONY!

HIlarious.. I just installed 0.25 and got all my mods set up, and you release .90 right when I come back to get mechjeb and finish it off.. IRONY!

Well, sometimes we just like to mess with people

Wait a minute... I've watched Interstellar today (it sucks btw) how long I was gone? o_O

Whaaaaaaatttt?! WHHHAAAAAAAATTTTTTTT?!?! WHAAAAATTTT?!?!?! WHAAAAAAAAATTT?!

*Goes on a rampage*

Edited December 16, 2014 by NeatCrown

I didn't update, did a fresh download instead. I'll try it out concurrent with 0.25.0, I've got missions in progress. I'll unpack it in a minute... can't wait to see. Thank you, Squad, splendid effort.

Of course my next question will be: How do I import my current 0.25.0 Science_Sandbox into Beta? lol

If you start a new 0.90 Career game under x64/windows, all your KSC facilities automagically start at L3

If you start your game under x86/32bit and then switch to x64, all your KSC facilities are automagically upgraded to L3 on load
Sweet! and it looks like a few mods have just become completely obsolete! (still will use CSS)
Talk about a nice surprise. =^.^=

A quick observation: the Mk3 fuselages have good mass ratios. While the best fuel tanks so far have been 1:9 (11.1%) dry mass to wet mass, the new fuselages have 3:28 (10.7%) for both liquid fuel and LFO, while the comparable 3.75 m fuel tanks have 5:41 (12.2%).

If you start a new 0.90 Career game under x64/windows, all your KSC facilities automagically start at L3

If you start your game under x86/32bit and then switch to x64, all your KSC facilities are automagically upgraded to L3 on load

Known bug

With the building upgrades now going on, and the job count limits and other challenges these introduce, playing the game where part research has a monetary expense (as I normally do) makes the game pretty much impossible without giving yourself %based handicaps to a cheating point at start.

I bow to any mad skills that can pull it off to endgame, stock, with it research expense on, in .90, without cheating.

/balance suggestion #1

P.S.Edit -- This is the most fun I've had in KSP... ever. The new stuff you can build; this is a whole new game ladies and gents.

Edited December 16, 2014 by Holyvision
I know what I'm going to be doing instead of getting gifts..
Wow just in time! Any news on save compatibility?
ermehgerd ermehgerd ermehgerd ermehgerd ermehgerd ermehgerd ermehgerd ermehgerd!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The B9 HL parts seem to be identical in shape to the new Mk3 parts... Which means that they are compatible! Which means I can use the B9 airliner cockpit with the new parts to make an airliner!
Well, then! I stop paying attention for twenty minutes or so and the new update drops. So much for getting any writing done tonight...

So I install KSP 0.90.0 All excited about everything, then realize something... The administration building is still unbalanced. I was sure it would have been fixed this time around. It disappointed me immediately. Cmon squad, I'm tired of tweaking this stuff myself! *grumble* reset cfg to 10%.. again!

PS: I don't want to hear "Then don't use it!" .. That's completely asinine. Why add a feature to a game that the average *non-cheating* user can't use without fixing it!??

Thanks for getting rid of all the old mod installation folders, Squad! I know I could've removed them myself, but I never really...felt like it... I had no idea that they took up so much window space until now!

So today after my Bio final, I excitedly checked the KSP website, and much to my excitement, 0.90 was out! so I hurridly began downloading, unzipped, and thought "something isn't right, I already have a 0.25 install..." After a few derpy minutes of trying to figure out what was going on, it dawned on me that I had accidentally downloaded version 0.25 and not 0.90 !

Finals... they wear down your brain haha
KSP 0.9 AND Elite:Dangerous released in the same 24-hour span?!?! Goodbye real-world, hello SPACE
